html: Willie Walsh, head IAG - which owns British Airways & Aer Lingus - says we should be 'sanguine' about Brexit. 'Brexit is inevitable. There are some issues that will need to deal with but it's not rocket science'. He's clear that planes will keep flying over Ireland
text:
Willie Walsh, head IAG - which owns British Airways & Aer Lingus - says we should be 'sanguine' about Brexit. 

'Brexit is inevitable. There are some issues that will need to deal with but it's not rocket science'. 

He's clear that planes will keep flying over Ireland

html: Report from @CommonsPACAC on devolution & Brexit; - Current mechanisms not fit for purpose - Whitehall cultures takes “little account” of “realities of devolution” - “Considerable ambiguity” over Sewel - Review should consider if Scotland Office still necessary or needs reform
text:
Report from @CommonsPACAC on devolution & Brexit;
- Current mechanisms not fit for purpose
- Whitehall cultures takes “little account” of “realities of devolution” 
- “Considerable ambiguity” over Sewel  
- Review should consider if Scotland Office still necessary or needs reform

html: Just been at a hate crime event with the Met police + they told me something really useful. If you’re on a bus + you witness a hate crime, if you give the police the number on the back of your Oyster/debit card, they can trace the bus + every passenger on it to find the culprit.
text:
Just been at a hate crime event with the Met police + they told me something really useful.

If you’re on a bus + you witness a hate crime, if you give the police the number on the back of your Oyster/debit card, they can trace the bus + every passenger on it to find the culprit.

Hate plastic polution? Then pledge..
-give up single use water bottles and carry your own
-don't buy sandwiches in a plastic wrapper
-use a refillable coffee cup
-buy fruit & vegetables loose
-carry long life shopping bag
-avoid plastic cutlery
-give up plastic straws
!

html: Did anyone ask a Remoaner 'what sort of Remain did you vote for, exactly?' Was it... 1. Soft-Remain (the current EU without changes within the bloc's structure, or among EU member states' stances toward it), or... 2. Hard-Remain (the envisaged United States of EU by 2025)?
text:
Did anyone ask a Remoaner 'what sort of Remain did you vote for, exactly?' 

Was it...

1. Soft-Remain (the current EU without changes within the bloc's structure, or among EU member states' stances toward it), or...

2. Hard-Remain (the envisaged United States of EU by 2025)?

html: 2/2 Staying in the customs union means effectively staying in the EU: the EU *is* a customs union. It means no new free trade deals, no new export opportunities, and no leading role in the WTO.
text: 2/2 Staying in the customs union means effectively staying in the EU: the EU *is* a customs union.  It means no new free trade deals, no new export opportunities, and no leading role in the WTO.

html: A year ago Goldman Sachs forecast sterling would fall from $1.25 to $1.14 in 2017. In fact, it rose to $1.35. Goldman also forecast 10-year gilt yields (cost of government borrowing) would rise from 1.28% to 1.65%. They fell to 1.19% by end-Dec.
text: A year ago Goldman Sachs forecast sterling would fall from $1.25 to $1.14 in 2017. In fact, it rose to $1.35. Goldman also forecast 10-year gilt yields (cost of government borrowing) would rise from 1.28% to 1.65%. They fell to 1.19% by end-Dec.
